Sentencas: The effect of hydrogen sulfide (H2S) on the performance of nickel/yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) cermet anode for solid oxide fuel cells has been studied under various operating conditions.
Titulo: Sulfur poisoning and regeneration of Ni-based anodes in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: In all cases, a small amount of H2S (ppm level) causes a sharp drop in cell performance within the first few minutes of exposure, followed by a gradual but persistent deterioration in performance for several days.
Titulo: Sulfur poisoning and regeneration of Ni-based anodes in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The extent of anode degradation caused by sulfur poisoning increases with increasing H2S concentration, increasing cell voltage (i. e., closer to open-circuit voltage or decreasing cell current density), or decreasing cell operating temperature.
Titulo: Sulfur poisoning and regeneration of Ni-based anodes in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The initial sharp degradation in performance is attributed to rapid adsorption of sulfur onto the Ni surface, which blocks the active sites for hydrogen adsorption and oxidation.
Titulo: Sulfur poisoning and regeneration of Ni-based anodes in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: However, the mechanism for the subsequent slow degradation is still not clear.
Titulo: Sulfur poisoning and regeneration of Ni-based anodes in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Upon removal of H2S from the fuel stream, the anode performance can be recovered fully or partially, depending on operating conditions and duration of H2S exposure.
Titulo: Sulfur poisoning and regeneration of Ni-based anodes in solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The rate of the recovery process increases with operating temperature and cell current density.
Titulo: Sulfur poisoning and regeneration of Ni-based anodes in solid oxide fuel cells
